byline.contributor: Mike McIntire contributed reporting. Kitty Bennett and Ryan Chittum contributed research.
byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and JULIE CRESWELL

abstract: Examination of internal documents from Panama law firm Mossack Fonseca, known as Panama Papers, finds firm had at least 2,400 United States-based wealthy clients, and set up at least 2,800 offshore companies on their behalf to shield money from taxes; for many of its American clients, firm offered how-to guide on avoiding United States tax and financial disclosure laws.
lead_paragraph: Mossack Fonseca, the Panamanian law firm at the center of the trove of revealing documents, offered a menu of services to conceal the true owners.

headline.main: Panama Papers Show How Rich United States Clients Hid Millions Abroad
headline.print_headline: Documents Show How Wealthy Hid  Millions Abroad
